Ideally it is exactly at the date. There can be *at most a month of leeway* to account for resolution issues and delays. If the delay is too long, the question should be marked invalid.\n   - In case of events that could resolve at an uncertain date (will Warren Buffet die of cancer?), the resolution date should be such that it is highly likely the event will happen before it. In this case, the `body` should say the question resolves N/A if the resolution date comes and there was no resolution.\n\n- The resolution criteria should not be excessively vague or ambiguous, and should be consistent with the question.\n\nThe format of your response should be:\nreasoning: [reasoning here]\nvalid: [True/False]\n\nExample 1:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2020?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected as the president of the United States before January 1, 2020.\nresolution_date: 2020-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body (resolution criteria) is clear and consistent with the title.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 2:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if it happens.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body is too vague.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 3:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States before January 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2030.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution criteria are clear and consistent with the title.\nThe resolution date is consistent with the title and in the future.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 4:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2031.\nresolution_date: 2031-12-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is too late compared to when the body says the question will resolve. It is in December 2031, while the body says the question should resolve by January 2031.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 5:\ntitle: Will any member of Kanye West\'s family become the president of the United States by 2035?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West or any of his family members (including his wife, children, siblings and parents) is elected and... Show More\n\nresolution_date: 2035-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: There is a "Show More" instead of the end of the resolution criteria.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 6:\ntitle: Will a new strain of influenza virus with pandemic potential be identified by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new strain of influenza virus is identified that meets the following criteria: \n- The strain must be genetically distinct from previously identified strains, with genetic differences significant enough to be considered a new strain by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body.\n- The strain must have demonstrated the ability to cause human infection and have the potential for sustained human-to-human transmission.\n- The strain must be assessed by the WHO or a similar authoritative body as having pandemic potential, meaning it has a significant risk of causing widespread illness across multiple countries or continents.\nIn the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, a consensus among at least three leading infectious disease research institutions will be considered sufficient for resolution.\nresolution_date: 2030-12-31 23:59:59\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "Pandemic potential" is way too subjective; it is not a clearly objective threshold. \nIn the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, a consensus among at least three leading infectious disease research institutions will be considered sufficient for resolution." is not good because it is not clear on what exactly they should agree on.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 7:\ntitle: Will DeepMind develop an AI with the capability to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, DeepMind has developed an artificial intelligence (AI) system that has been publicly recognized to significantly disrupt at least one major industry.  The AI system must be a primary factor in the disruption, as opposed to a contributing technology among others. The industry in question must be one of the following: healthcare, automotive, finance, entertainment, or energy. Disruption is considered significant if it leads to a change in at least 20%% of the market share within the industry or a comparable metric of impact, such as a 20%% increase in efficiency or productivity. The resolution will rely on reports and analyses from the specified industry sources published by December 31, 2030. In the absence of clear industry consensus, a panel of experts from the affected industry may be consulted to determine the resolution.\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030" is too fuzzy. The resolution criteria must be quantifiable. "20%% increase in efficiency or productivity" is clearly not measurable.\nIn addition, we do not want multiple distinct pathways to resolution in a question where it is not important there are multiple pathways.\nHere, we have both the market share and "a comparable metric of impact" as resolution criteria, and notwithstanding the fact that impact is not defined clearly, we should not have both.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 8:\ntitle: Will France win any major football tournament by 2026?\nbody: France has last won the FIFA World Cup in 2018. This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, the French national football team (senior, not youth or women\'s) has won either the FIFA World Cup or the UEFA European Championship.\nresolution_date: 2026-12-31 23:59:59\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is fine. The body is clear; there are multiple distinct pathways to resolution, but all are important for the question. The body includes a bit of background information that is not necessary for the question, but it is not harmful.\nvalid: True\n-----\n\ntitle: Conditional on Europa being the first place humanity discovers extraterrestrial life before 2045, will we find life on Mars by 2050?\nbody: Suppose the following is true: Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. Extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means. Then, will prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050?\nresolution_date: 2050-12-31 00:00:00+00:00\n'}]

{'model': 'gpt-4o-mini', 'response_model': <class 'common.datatypes.Prob'>, 'temperature': 0.5} Approx num tokens: 607
question.body: Resolution Criteria for P:
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
This question will resolve as Yes if there is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory
Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

question.body: Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

question.body: Resolution Criteria for P:
This question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
Fine Print for P:
We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
This question will resolve as Yes if any of the following conditions are not met before January 1, 2031:
The Insurrection Act is not invoked.
While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are not at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
Not all of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Fine Print for Q:
Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.
Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.
Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.

Suppose the following is true: There is a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120. Then is the USA not entering a second civil war before 2031?

In this case, the `body` should say the question resolves N/A if the resolution date comes and there was no resolution.\n\n- The resolution criteria should not be excessively vague or ambiguous, and should be consistent with the question.\n\nThe format of your response should be:\nreasoning: [reasoning here]\nvalid: [True/False]\n\nExample 1:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2020?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected as the president of the United States before January 1, 2020.\nresolution_date: 2020-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body (resolution criteria) is clear and consistent with the title.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 2:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if it happens.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body is too vague.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 3:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States before January 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2030.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution criteria are clear and consistent with the title.\nThe resolution date is consistent with the title and in the future.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 4:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2031.\nresolution_date: 2031-12-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is too late compared to when the body says the question will resolve. Show More\n\nresolution_date: 2035-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: There is a "Show More" instead of the end of the resolution criteria.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 6:\ntitle: Will a new strain of influenza virus with pandemic potential be identified by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new strain of influenza virus is identified that meets the following criteria: \n- The strain must be genetically distinct from previously identified strains, with genetic differences significant enough to be considered a new strain by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body.\n- The strain must have demonstrated the ability to cause human infection and have the potential for sustained human-to-human transmission.\n- The strain must be assessed by the WHO or a similar authoritative body as having pandemic potential, meaning it has a significant risk of causing widespread illness across multiple countries or continents.\nIn the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, a consensus among at least three leading infectious disease research institutions will be considered sufficient for resolution.\nresolution_date: 2030-12-31 23:59:59\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "Pandemic potential" is way too subjective; it is not a clearly objective threshold. \nIn the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, a consensus among at least three leading infectious disease research institutions will be considered sufficient for resolution." is not good because it is not clear on what exactly they should agree on.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 7:\ntitle: Will DeepMind develop an AI with the capability to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, DeepMind has developed an artificial intelligence (AI) system that has been publicly recognized to significantly disrupt at least one major industry.  The AI system must be a primary factor in the disruption, as opposed to a contributing technology among others. The industry in question must be one of the following: healthcare, automotive, finance, entertainment, or energy. Disruption is considered significant if it leads to a change in at least 20%% of the market share within the industry or a comparable metric of impact, such as a 20%% increase in efficiency or productivity. The resolution will rely on reports and analyses from the specified industry sources published by December 31, 2030. In the absence of clear industry consensus, a panel of experts from the affected industry may be consulted to determine the resolution.\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030" is too fuzzy. The resolution criteria must be quantifiable. "20%% increase in efficiency or productivity" is clearly not measurable.\nIn addition, we do not want multiple distinct pathways to resolution in a question where it is not important there are multiple pathways.\nHere, we have both the market share and "a comparable metric of impact" as resolution criteria, and notwithstanding the fact that impact is not defined clearly, we should not have both.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 8:\ntitle: Will France win any major football tournament by 2026?\nbody: France has last won the FIFA World Cup in 2018. This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, the French national football team (senior, not youth or women\'s) has won either the FIFA World Cup or the UEFA European Championship.\nresolution_date: 2026-12-31 23:59:59\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is fine. The body is clear; there are multiple distinct pathways to resolution, but all are important for the question. The body includes a bit of background information that is not necessary for the question, but it is not harmful.\nvalid: True\n-----\n\ntitle: Conditional on there being a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120, will the USA not enter a second civil war before 2031?\nbody: Resolution Criteria for P:\nThis question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.\nFine Print for P:\nWe\'ll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):\nThe stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.\n\nResolution Criteria for Q:\nThis question will resolve as Yes if any of the following conditions are not met before January 1, 2031:\nThe Insurrection Act is not invoked.\nWhile the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are not at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.\nNot all of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).\nFine Print for Q:\nAny conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.\nConflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.\nDeaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.\n\nSuppose the following is true: There is a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120. Then is the USA not entering a second civil war before 2031?\nresolution_date: 2119-12-31 00:00:00+00:00\n'}]
{'model': 'gpt-4o-mini', 'response_model': <class 'common.datatypes.Prob'>, 'temperature': 0.5} Approx num tokens: 318

question.body: Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
Fine Print
We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

Ideally it is exactly at the date. There can be *at most a month of leeway* to account for resolution issues and delays. If this has happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as Yes."}

Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.\nConflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.\nDeaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.\n\nSuppose the following is true: There is a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120. Then is the USA not entering a second civil war before 2031?"}

question.body: Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (i) living currently and (ii) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

current_date: 2024-07-20 20:29:44.916558
kwargs: {'model': 'gpt-4o-mini'}
options: {'model': 'gpt-4o-mini', 'temperature': 0.5, 'response_model': <class 'common.datatypes.VerificationResult'>}
messages: [{'role': 'system', 'content': 'You are a helpful assistant.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'I want you to help me validate if a forecasting question (as on sites like Metaculus / Manifold) is well defined. \nThe question will ask about an event in the future or past.\nThe fields are:\n- title: The title of the question.\n- body: The resolution criteria of the question.\n- resolution_date: The date when the outcome of the question will be decided.\n\nI want you to validate according to the following criteria:\n\n- The resolution date should be consistent with the question. In particular:\n   - In case of events that happen at a fixed time (e.g. "Will France win the FIFA World Cup in 2026"), it should *never* be *before* the date when the event is scheduled to happen. Ideally it is exactly at the date. There can be *at most a month of leeway* to account for resolution issues and delays. If the delay is too long, the question should be marked invalid.\n   - In case of events that could resolve at an uncertain date (will Warren Buffet die of cancer?), the resolution date should be such that it is highly likely the event will happen before it. In this case, the `body` should say the question resolves N/A if the resolution date comes and there was no resolution.\n\n- The resolution criteria should not be excessively vague or ambiguous, and should be consistent with the question.\n\nThe format of your response should be:\nreasoning: [reasoning here]\nvalid: [True/False]\n\nExample 1:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2020?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected as the president of the United States before January 1, 2020.\nresolution_date: 2020-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body (resolution criteria) is clear and consistent with the title.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 2:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if it happens.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body is too vague.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 3:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States before January 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2030.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution criteria are clear and consistent with the title.\nThe resolution date is consistent with the title and in the future.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 4:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2031.\nresolution_date: 2031-12-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is too late compared to when the body says the question will resolve. It is in December 2031, while the body says the question should resolve by January 2031.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 5:\ntitle: Will any member of Kanye West\'s family become the president of the United States by 2035?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West or any of his family members (including his wife, children, siblings and parents) is elected and... Show More\n\nresolution_date: 2035-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: There is a "Show More" instead of the end of the resolution criteria.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 6:\ntitle: Will a new strain of influenza virus with pandemic potential be identified by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new strain of influenza virus is identified that meets the following criteria: \n- The strain must be genetically distinct from previously identified strains, with genetic differences significant enough to be considered a new strain by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body.\n- The strain must have demonstrated the ability to cause human infection and have the potential for sustained human-to-human transmission.\n- The strain must be assessed by the WHO or a similar authoritative body as having pandemic potential, meaning it has a significant risk of causing widespread illness across multiple countries or continents.\nIn the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, a consensus among at least three leading infectious disease research institutions will be considered sufficient for resolution.\nresolution_date: 2030-12-31 23:59:59\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "Pandemic potential" is way too subjective; it is not a clearly objective threshold. \nIn the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, a consensus among at least three leading infectious disease research institutions will be considered sufficient for resolution." is not good because it is not clear on what exactly they should agree on.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 7:\ntitle: Will DeepMind develop an AI with the capability to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, DeepMind has developed an artificial intelligence (AI) system that has been publicly recognized to significantly disrupt at least one major industry.  The AI system must be a primary factor in the disruption, as opposed to a contributing technology among others. The industry in question must be one of the following: healthcare, automotive, finance, entertainment, or energy. Disruption is considered significant if it leads to a change in at least 20%% of the market share within the industry or a comparable metric of impact, such as a 20%% increase in efficiency or productivity. The resolution will rely on reports and analyses from the specified industry sources published by December 31, 2030. In the absence of clear industry consensus, a panel of experts from the affected industry may be consulted to determine the resolution.\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030" is too fuzzy. The resolution criteria must be quantifiable. "20%% increase in efficiency or productivity" is clearly not measurable.\nIn addition, we do not want multiple distinct pathways to resolution in a question where it is not important there are multiple pathways.\nHere, we have both the market share and "a comparable metric of impact" as resolution criteria, and notwithstanding the fact that impact is not defined clearly, we should not have both.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 8:\ntitle: Will France win any major football tournament by 2026?\nbody: France has last won the FIFA World Cup in 2018. This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, the French national football team (senior, not youth or women\'s) has won either the FIFA World Cup or the UEFA European Championship.\nresolution_date: 2026-12-31 23:59:59\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is fine. The body is clear; there are multiple distinct pathways to resolution, but all are important for the question. The body includes a bit of background information that is not necessary for the question, but it is not harmful.\nvalid: True\n-----\n\ntitle: Will both of the following occur: (a) Europa will be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045, and (b) we will find life on Mars by 2050?\nbody: Resolution Criteria\nThis question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:\n(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (i) living currently and (ii) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.\n(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.\n\nresolution_date: 2050-12-31 00:00:00+00:00\n'}]
Received the following response from OpenAI API: prob=0.7
{'model': 'gpt-4o-mini', 'response_model': <class 'static_checks.MiniInstantiator.Paraphrase.OutputFormat_stripped'>, 'temperature': 0.5} Approx num tokens: 688
question.body: Resolution Criteria for P:
This question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
Fine Print for P:
We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
The Insurrection Act is invoked.
While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Fine Print for Q:
Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.
Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.
Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.

Suppose the following is true: There is a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120. Then is the USA entering a second civil war before 2031?

Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.\nConflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.\nDeaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.\n\nSuppose the following is true: There is a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120. Then is the USA entering a second civil war before 2031?\nresolution_date: 2119-12-31 00:00:00+00:00\n'}]
question.body: Resolution Criteria
This question will be answered with Yes if humanity finds credible evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before discovering extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the cosmos. If credible extraterrestrial life is discovered elsewhere before it is found on Europa, this question will be answered with No. If no extraterrestrial life is detected before 2045, this question will be declared Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) currently living and (b) highly improbable to be a result of contamination from Earth spacecraft. This allows for the possibility of life that may have been transported from Earth through other non-human-engineered methods.
current_date: 2024-07-20 20:29:45.845695
kwargs: {'model': 'gpt-4o-mini'}
options: {'model': 'gpt-4o-mini', 'temperature': 0.5, 'response_model': <class 'common.datatypes.VerificationResult'>}
messages: [{'role': 'system', 'content': 'You are a helpful assistant.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'I want you to help me validate if a forecasting question (as on sites like Metaculus / Manifold) is well defined. \nThe question will ask about an event in the future or past.\nThe fields are:\n- title: The title of the question.\n- body: The resolution criteria of the question.\n- resolution_date: The date when the outcome of the question will be decided.\n\nI want you to validate according to the following criteria:\n\n- The resolution date should be consistent with the question. In particular:\n   - In case of events that happen at a fixed time (e.g. "Will France win the FIFA World Cup in 2026"), it should *never* be *before* the date when the event is scheduled to happen. Ideally it is exactly at the date. There can be *at most a month of leeway* to account for resolution issues and delays. If the delay is too long, the question should be marked invalid.\n   - In case of events that could resolve at an uncertain date (will Warren Buffet die of cancer?), the resolution date should be such that it is highly likely the event will happen before it. In this case, the `body` should say the question resolves N/A if the resolution date comes and there was no resolution.\n\n- The resolution criteria should not be excessively vague or ambiguous, and should be consistent with the question.\n\nThe format of your response should be:\nreasoning: [reasoning here]\nvalid: [True/False]\n\nExample 1:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2020?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected as the president of the United States before January 1, 2020.\nresolution_date: 2020-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body (resolution criteria) is clear and consistent with the title.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 2:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if it happens.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body is too vague.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 3:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States before January 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2030.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution criteria are clear and consistent with the title.\nThe resolution date is consistent with the title and in the future.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 4:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2031.\nresolution_date: 2031-12-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is too late compared to when the body says the question will resolve. It is in December 2031, while the body says the question should resolve by January 2031.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 5:\ntitle: Will any member of Kanye West\'s family become the president of the United States by 2035?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West or any of his family members (including his wife, children, siblings and parents) is elected and... Show More\n\nresolution_date: 2035-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: There is a "Show More" instead of the end of the resolution criteria.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 6:\ntitle: Will a new strain of influenza virus with pandemic potential be identified by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new strain of influenza virus is identified that meets the following criteria: \n- The strain must be genetically distinct from previously identified strains, with genetic differences significant enough to be considered a new strain by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body.\n- The strain must have demonstrated the ability to cause human infection and have the potential for sustained human-to-human transmission.\n- The strain must be assessed by the WHO or a similar authoritative body as having pandemic potential, meaning it has a significant risk of causing widespread illness across multiple countries or continents.\nIn the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, a consensus among at least three leading infectious disease research institutions will be considered sufficient for resolution.\nresolution_date: 2030-12-31 23:59:59\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "Pandemic potential" is way too subjective; it is not a clearly objective threshold. \nIn the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, a consensus among at least three leading infectious disease research institutions will be considered sufficient for resolution." is not good because it is not clear on what exactly they should agree on.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 7:\ntitle: Will DeepMind develop an AI with the capability to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, DeepMind has developed an artificial intelligence (AI) system that has been publicly recognized to significantly disrupt at least one major industry.  The AI system must be a primary factor in the disruption, as opposed to a contributing technology among others. The industry in question must be one of the following: healthcare, automotive, finance, entertainment, or energy. Disruption is considered significant if it leads to a change in at least 20%% of the market share within the industry or a comparable metric of impact, such as a 20%% increase in efficiency or productivity. The resolution will rely on reports and analyses from the specified industry sources published by December 31, 2030. In the absence of clear industry consensus, a panel of experts from the affected industry may be consulted to determine the resolution.\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030" is too fuzzy. The resolution criteria must be quantifiable. "20%% increase in efficiency or productivity" is clearly not measurable.\nIn addition, we do not want multiple distinct pathways to resolution in a question where it is not important there are multiple pathways.\nHere, we have both the market share and "a comparable metric of impact" as resolution criteria, and notwithstanding the fact that impact is not defined clearly, we should not have both.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 8:\ntitle: Will France win any major football tournament by 2026?\nbody: France has last won the FIFA World Cup in 2018. This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, the French national football team (senior, not youth or women\'s) has won either the FIFA World Cup or the UEFA European Championship.\nresolution_date: 2026-12-31 23:59:59\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is fine. The body is clear; there are multiple distinct pathways to resolution, but all are important for the question. The body includes a bit of background information that is not necessary for the question, but it is not harmful.\nvalid: True\n-----\n\ntitle: Will Europa be the initial location where humanity identifies extraterrestrial life, assuming it is found prior to 2045?\nbody: Resolution Criteria\nThis question will be answered with Yes if humanity finds credible evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before discovering extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the cosmos. If credible extraterrestrial life is discovered elsewhere before it is found on Europa, this question will be answered with No. If no extraterrestrial life is detected before 2045, this question will be declared Annulled.\nNote: extraterrestrial life must be (a) currently living and (b) highly improbable to be a result of contamination from Earth spacecraft. This allows for the possibility of life that may have been transported from Earth through other non-human-engineered methods.\nresolution_date: 2044-12-31 00:00:00+00:00\n'}]

question.body: Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if at least one of the following conditions is met:
(a) There is not a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
(b) Not all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
- The Insurrection Act is not invoked.
- While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are not at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
- Not all of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Fine Print
For condition (a), we'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.
For condition (b), any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.
Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.
Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.

question.body: Let’s consider the following scenario: Humanity uncovers credible evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so prior to finding extraterrestrial life elsewhere in the cosmos. The extraterrestrial life must be (a) presently alive and (b) very unlikely to have originated from contamination by Earth spacecraft. This scenario allows for the possibility of life being transferred from Earth through other non-human means. In that case, will esteemed and reputable scientific organizations declare that humans have found clear evidence of either current or historical life on Mars, separate from any life that may have been transported from Earth to Mars via human missions, before January 1, 2050?

question.body: Resolution Criteria
This question will be answered affirmatively if, at any point from January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, the average life expectancy at birth (for both genders) in the US is reported as being below 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. A formal announcement from any of these organizations will suffice to resolve the question.

In particular:\n   - In case of events that happen at a fixed time (e.g. "Will France win the FIFA World Cup in 2026"), it should *never* be *before* the date when the event is scheduled to happen. Ideally it is exactly at the date. There can be *at most a month of leeway* to account for resolution issues and delays. If the delay is too long, the question should be marked invalid.\n   - In case of events that could resolve at an uncertain date (will Warren Buffet die of cancer?), the resolution date should be such that it is highly likely the event will happen before it. In this case, the `body` should say the question resolves N/A if the resolution date comes and there was no resolution.\n\n- The resolution criteria should not be excessively vague or ambiguous, and should be consistent with the question.\n\nThe format of your response should be:\nreasoning: [reasoning here]\nvalid: [True/False]\n\nExample 1:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2020?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected as the president of the United States before January 1, 2020.\nresolution_date: 2020-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body (resolution criteria) is clear and consistent with the title.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 2:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if it happens.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body is too vague.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 3:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States before January 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2030.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution criteria are clear and consistent with the title.\nThe resolution date is consistent with the title and in the future.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 4:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2031.\nresolution_date: 2031-12-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is too late compared to when the body says the question will resolve. It is in December 2031, while the body says the question should resolve by January 2031.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 5:\ntitle: Will any member of Kanye West\'s family become the president of the United States by 2035?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West or any of his family members (including his wife, children, siblings and parents) is elected and... Show More\n\nresolution_date: 2035-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: There is a "Show More" instead of the end of the resolution criteria.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 6:\ntitle: Will a new strain of influenza virus with pandemic potential be identified by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new strain of influenza virus is identified that meets the following criteria: \n- The strain must be genetically distinct from previously identified strains, with genetic differences significant enough to be considered a new strain by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body.\n- The strain must have demonstrated the ability to cause human infection and have the potential for sustained human-to-human transmission.\n- The strain must be assessed by the WHO or a similar authoritative body as having pandemic potential, meaning it has a significant risk of causing widespread illness across multiple countries or continents.\nIn the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, a consensus among at least three leading infectious disease research institutions will be considered sufficient for resolution.\nresolution_date: 2030-12-31 23:59:59\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "Pandemic potential" is way too subjective; it is not a clearly objective threshold. \nIn the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, a consensus among at least three leading infectious disease research institutions will be considered sufficient for resolution." is not good because it is not clear on what exactly they should agree on.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 7:\ntitle: Will DeepMind develop an AI with the capability to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, DeepMind has developed an artificial intelligence (AI) system that has been publicly recognized to significantly disrupt at least one major industry.  The AI system must be a primary factor in the disruption, as opposed to a contributing technology among others. The industry in question must be one of the following: healthcare, automotive, finance, entertainment, or energy. Disruption is considered significant if it leads to a change in at least 20%% of the market share within the industry or a comparable metric of impact, such as a 20%% increase in efficiency or productivity. The resolution will rely on reports and analyses from the specified industry sources published by December 31, 2030. In the absence of clear industry consensus, a panel of experts from the affected industry may be consulted to determine the resolution.\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030" is too fuzzy. The resolution criteria must be quantifiable. "20%% increase in efficiency or productivity" is clearly not measurable.\nIn addition, we do not want multiple distinct pathways to resolution in a question where it is not important there are multiple pathways.\nHere, we have both the market share and "a comparable metric of impact" as resolution criteria, and notwithstanding the fact that impact is not defined clearly, we should not have both.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 8:\ntitle: Will France win any major football tournament by 2026?\nbody: France has last won the FIFA World Cup in 2018. This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, the French national football team (senior, not youth or women\'s) has won either the FIFA World Cup or the UEFA European Championship.\nresolution_date: 2026-12-31 23:59:59\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is fine. The body is clear; there are multiple distinct pathways to resolution, but all are important for the question. The body includes a bit of background information that is not necessary for the question, but it is not harmful.\nvalid: True\n-----\n\ntitle: Will the average life expectancy at birth in the United States for both genders drop under 75 years prior to 2040?\nbody: Resolution Criteria\nThis question will be answered affirmatively if, at any point from January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, the average life expectancy at birth (for both genders) in the US is reported as being below 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. A formal announcement from any of these organizations will suffice to resolve the question.\nresolution_date: 2039-12-31 00:00:00+00:00\n'}]

question.body: Criteria for Resolution
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the subsequent events happen:
(a) At any point from January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, the average life expectancy at birth in the US (for both genders) falls below 75 years, as reported by the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. A formal declaration from any of these organizations will suffice to resolve the question.
(b) An armed conflict arises before January 1, 2070, in which at least one of the following scenarios is true:
- Three nations each set off a minimum of 10 nuclear weapons with a yield of at least 10 kilotons outside their own borders.
- Two nations each set off at least 50 nuclear weapons with a yield of at least 10 kilotons outside their own borders.
These scenarios are designed to exclude a two-party regional nuclear conflict, such as one between India and Pakistan, or Israel and another nation, or the UK and France, as catastrophic as those would be.
As with many inquiries that have a positive resolution condition that might prevent earning points on Metaculus, predictors are encouraged to make predictions in good faith, as points will not be granted until 2070 regardless.

In particular:\n   - In case of events that happen at a fixed time (e.g. "Will France win the FIFA World Cup in 2026"), it should *never* be *before* the date when the event is scheduled to happen. Ideally it is exactly at the date. There can be *at most a month of leeway* to account for resolution issues and delays. Use synonyms, etc. Notes:\n\n - Make sure to retain all information in the question title and body! Paraphrase, but don\'t discard the essential meaning. This is very important.\n - Something to note: you cannot rephrase P to \'Do you think that P?\', \'Is P likely?\' or \'Will there be evidence of P?\'. These are not paraphrases, they mean different things (something may be likely and not happen, etc.).\n\n{"P":{"title":"Conditional on there being a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120, will the USA enter a second civil war before 2031?","body":"Resolution Criteria for P:\\nThis question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.\\nFine Print for P:\\nWe\'ll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):\\nThe stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.\\n\\nResolution Criteria for Q:\\nThis question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:\\nThe Insurrection Act is invoked.\\nWhile the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.\\nAll of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).\\nFine Print for Q:\\nAny conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. If credible extraterrestrial life is discovered elsewhere before it is found on Europa, this question will be answered with No. If no extraterrestrial life is detected before 2045, this question will be declared Annulled.\nNote: extraterrestrial life must be (a) currently living and (b) highly improbable to be a result of contamination from Earth spacecraft. This allows for the possibility of life that may have been transported from Earth through other non-human-engineered methods."}

question.body: Criteria for determining P:
This question will be answered with Yes if, at any point from January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, the life expectancy at birth (average for both genders) in the US is recorded as less than 75 years, as per the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. A formal announcement from any of these organizations will suffice to resolve the inquiry.

Criteria for determining Q:
This question will be answered with Yes if there is a military confrontation occurring before January 1, 2070 that meets either of the following criteria:
Three nations each launch at least 10 nuclear weapons with a minimum yield of 10 kilotons outside their own borders.
Two nations each launch at least 50 nuclear weapons with a minimum yield of 10 kilotons outside their own borders.
These criteria are established to exclude a two-nation regional nuclear conflict, such as one between India and Pakistan, or Israel and another nation, or the UK and France, even though such a scenario would be catastrophic.
As with many inquiries that have a condition for positive resolution which may prevent the awarding of points on Metaculus, participants are encouraged to make predictions in good faith, as points will not be granted until 2070 in any case.

Assuming the following holds: US life expectancy at birth for both genders falls below 75 years before 2040. Is it then the case that a global thermonuclear war will take place by 2070?

Ideally it is exactly at the date. There can be *at most a month of leeway* to account for resolution issues and delays. The AI system must be a primary factor in the disruption, as opposed to a contributing technology among others. The industry in question must be one of the following: healthcare, automotive, finance, entertainment, or energy. Disruption is considered significant if it leads to a change in at least 20%% of the market share within the industry or a comparable metric of impact, such as a 20%% increase in efficiency or productivity. The resolution will rely on reports and analyses from the specified industry sources published by December 31, 2030. In the absence of clear industry consensus, a panel of experts from the affected industry may be consulted to determine the resolution.\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030" is too fuzzy. The resolution criteria must be quantifiable. "20%% increase in efficiency or productivity" is clearly not measurable.\nIn addition, we do not want multiple distinct pathways to resolution in a question where it is not important there are multiple pathways.\nHere, we have both the market share and "a comparable metric of impact" as resolution criteria, and notwithstanding the fact that impact is not defined clearly, we should not have both.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 8:\ntitle: Will France win any major football tournament by 2026?\nbody: France has last won the FIFA World Cup in 2018. This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, the French national football team (senior, not youth or women\'s) has won either the FIFA World Cup or the UEFA European Championship.\nresolution_date: 2026-12-31 23:59:59\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is fine. The body is clear; there are multiple distinct pathways to resolution, but all are important for the question. The body includes a bit of background information that is not necessary for the question, but it is not harmful.\nvalid: True\n-----\n\ntitle: If the life expectancy at birth for both genders in the US drops below 75 years prior to 2040, will a worldwide nuclear war occur by 2070?\nbody: Criteria for determining P:\nThis question will be answered with Yes if, at any point from January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, the life expectancy at birth (average for both genders) in the US is recorded as less than 75 years, as per the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. A formal announcement from any of these organizations will suffice to resolve the inquiry.\n\nCriteria for determining Q:\nThis question will be answered with Yes if there is a military confrontation occurring before January 1, 2070 that meets either of the following criteria:\nThree nations each launch at least 10 nuclear weapons with a minimum yield of 10 kilotons outside their own borders.\nTwo nations each launch at least 50 nuclear weapons with a minimum yield of 10 kilotons outside their own borders.\nThese criteria are established to exclude a two-nation regional nuclear conflict, such as one between India and Pakistan, or Israel and another nation, or the UK and France, even though such a scenario would be catastrophic.\nAs with many inquiries that have a condition for positive resolution which may prevent the awarding of points on Metaculus, participants are encouraged to make predictions in good faith, as points will not be granted until 2070 in any case.\n\nAssuming the following holds: US life expectancy at birth for both genders falls below 75 years before 2040. Is it then the case that a global thermonuclear war will take place by 2070?\nresolution_date: 2070-12-31 00:00:00+00:00\n'}]

question.body: Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

messages: [{'role': 'system', 'content': 'You are a helpful assistant.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'I want you to help me validate if a forecasting question (as on sites like Metaculus / Manifold) is well defined. \nThe question will ask about an event in the future or past.\nThe fields are:\n- title: The title of the question.\n- body: The resolution criteria of the question.\n- resolution_date: The date when the outcome of the question will be decided.\n\nI want you to validate according to the following criteria:\n\n- The resolution date should be consistent with the question. In particular:\n   - In case of events that happen at a fixed time (e.g. "Will France win the FIFA World Cup in 2026"), it should *never* be *before* the date when the event is scheduled to happen. Ideally it is exactly at the date. There can be *at most a month of leeway* to account for resolution issues and delays. If the delay is too long, the question should be marked invalid.\n   - In case of events that could resolve at an uncertain date (will Warren Buffet die of cancer?), the resolution date should be such that it is highly likely the event will happen before it. In this case, the `body` should say the question resolves N/A if the resolution date comes and there was no resolution.\n\n- The resolution criteria should not be excessively vague or ambiguous, and should be consistent with the question.\n\nThe format of your response should be:\nreasoning: [reasoning here]\nvalid: [True/False]\n\nExample 1:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2020?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected as the president of the United States before January 1, 2020.\nresolution_date: 2020-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body (resolution criteria) is clear and consistent with the title.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 2:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if it happens.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body is too vague.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 3:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States before January 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2030.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution criteria are clear and consistent with the title.\nThe resolution date is consistent with the title and in the future.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 4:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2031.\nresolution_date: 2031-12-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is too late compared to when the body says the question will resolve. {'model': 'gpt-4o-mini', 'response_model': <class 'common.datatypes.Prob'>, 'temperature': 0.5} Approx num tokens: 643
question.body: Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met:
(a) There is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
(b) All of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
- The Insurrection Act is invoked.
- While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
- All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Fine Print
For condition (a), we'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.
For condition (b), any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.
Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.
Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.

current_date: 2024-07-20 20:29:54.767447
kwargs: {'model': 'gpt-4o-mini'}
options: {'model': 'gpt-4o-mini', 'temperature': 0.5, 'response_model': <class 'common.datatypes.VerificationResult'>}
messages: [{'role': 'system', 'content': 'You are a helpful assistant.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'I want you to help me validate if a forecasting question (as on sites like Metaculus / Manifold) is well defined. \nThe question will ask about an event in the future or past.\nThe fields are:\n- title: The title of the question.\n- body: The resolution criteria of the question.\n- resolution_date: The date when the outcome of the question will be decided.\n\nI want you to validate according to the following criteria:\n\n- The resolution date should be consistent with the question. In particular:\n   - In case of events that happen at a fixed time (e.g. "Will France win the FIFA World Cup in 2026"), it should *never* be *before* the date when the event is scheduled to happen. Ideally it is exactly at the date. There can be *at most a month of leeway* to account for resolution issues and delays. If the delay is too long, the question should be marked invalid.\n   - In case of events that could resolve at an uncertain date (will Warren Buffet die of cancer?), the resolution date should be such that it is highly likely the event will happen before it. In this case, the `body` should say the question resolves N/A if the resolution date comes and there was no resolution.\n\n- The resolution criteria should not be excessively vague or ambiguous, and should be consistent with the question.\n\nThe format of your response should be:\nreasoning: [reasoning here]\nvalid: [True/False]\n\nExample 1:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2020?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected as the president of the United States before January 1, 2020.\nresolution_date: 2020-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body (resolution criteria) is clear and consistent with the title.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 2:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if it happens.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The body is too vague.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 3:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States before January 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2030.\nresolution_date: 2030-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution criteria are clear and consistent with the title.\nThe resolution date is consistent with the title and in the future.\nvalid: True\n\n\nExample 4:\ntitle: Will Kanye West become the president of the United States by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West is elected and inaugurated as the president of the United States before January 1, 2031.\nresolution_date: 2031-12-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is too late compared to when the body says the question will resolve. It is in December 2031, while the body says the question should resolve by January 2031.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 5:\ntitle: Will any member of Kanye West\'s family become the president of the United States by 2035?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if Kanye West or any of his family members (including his wife, children, siblings and parents) is elected and... Show More\n\nresolution_date: 2035-01-01 00:00:00\n\n->\n\nreasoning: There is a "Show More" instead of the end of the resolution criteria.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 6:\ntitle: Will a new strain of influenza virus with pandemic potential be identified by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new strain of influenza virus is identified that meets the following criteria: \n- The strain must be genetically distinct from previously identified strains, with genetic differences significant enough to be considered a new strain by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body.\n- The strain must have demonstrated the ability to cause human infection and have the potential for sustained human-to-human transmission.\n- The strain must be assessed by the WHO or a similar authoritative body as having pandemic potential, meaning it has a significant risk of causing widespread illness across multiple countries or continents.\nIn the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, a consensus among at least three leading infectious disease research institutions will be considered sufficient for resolution.\nresolution_date: 2030-12-31 23:59:59\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "Pandemic potential" is way too subjective; it is not a clearly objective threshold. \nIn the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, a consensus among at least three leading infectious disease research institutions will be considered sufficient for resolution." is not good because it is not clear on what exactly they should agree on.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 7:\ntitle: Will DeepMind develop an AI with the capability to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030?\nbody: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, DeepMind has developed an artificial intelligence (AI) system that has been publicly recognized to significantly disrupt at least one major industry.  The AI system must be a primary factor in the disruption, as opposed to a contributing technology among others. The industry in question must be one of the following: healthcare, automotive, finance, entertainment, or energy. Disruption is considered significant if it leads to a change in at least 20%% of the market share within the industry or a comparable metric of impact, such as a 20%% increase in efficiency or productivity. The resolution will rely on reports and analyses from the specified industry sources published by December 31, 2030. In the absence of clear industry consensus, a panel of experts from the affected industry may be consulted to determine the resolution.\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030" is too fuzzy. The resolution criteria must be quantifiable. "20%% increase in efficiency or productivity" is clearly not measurable.\nIn addition, we do not want multiple distinct pathways to resolution in a question where it is not important there are multiple pathways.\nHere, we have both the market share and "a comparable metric of impact" as resolution criteria, and notwithstanding the fact that impact is not defined clearly, we should not have both.\nvalid: False\n\n\nExample 8:\ntitle: Will France win any major football tournament by 2026?\nbody: France has last won the FIFA World Cup in 2018. This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, the French national football team (senior, not youth or women\'s) has won either the FIFA World Cup or the UEFA European Championship.\nresolution_date: 2026-12-31 23:59:59\n\n->\n\nreasoning: The resolution date is fine. The body is clear; there are multiple distinct pathways to resolution, but all are important for the question. The body includes a bit of background information that is not necessary for the question, but it is not harmful.\nvalid: True\n-----\n\ntitle: Will both of the following occur: (a) There be a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120 and (b) The USA enter a second civil war before 2031?\nbody: Resolution Criteria\nThis question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met:\n(a) There is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.\n(b) All of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:\n- The Insurrection Act is invoked.\n- While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.\n- All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).\nFine Print\nFor condition (a), we\'ll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):\nThe stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.\nFor condition (b), any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.\nConflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.\nDeaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.\n\nresolution_date: 2119-12-31 00:00:00+00:00\n'}]
{'model': 'gpt-4o-mini', 'response_model': <class 'common.datatypes.Prob'>, 'temperature': 0.5} Approx num tokens: 340

Prompt: {"title":"If the life expectancy at birth for both genders in the US drops below 75 years prior to 2040, will a worldwide nuclear war occur by 2070?","body":"Criteria for determining P:\nThis question will be answered with Yes if, at any point from January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, the life expectancy at birth (average for both genders) in the US is recorded as less than 75 years, as per the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. A formal announcement from any of these organizations will suffice to resolve the inquiry.\n\nCriteria for determining Q:\nThis question will be answered with Yes if there is a military confrontation occurring before January 1, 2070 that meets either of the following criteria:\nThree nations each launch at least 10 nuclear weapons with a minimum yield of 10 kilotons outside their own borders.\nTwo nations each launch at least 50 nuclear weapons with a minimum yield of 10 kilotons outside their own borders.\nThese criteria are established to exclude a two-nation regional nuclear conflict, such as one between India and Pakistan, or Israel and another nation, or the UK and France, even though such a scenario would be catastrophic.\nAs with many inquiries that have a condition for positive resolution which may prevent the awarding of points on Metaculus, participants are encouraged to make predictions in good faith, as points will not be granted until 2070 in any case.\n\nAssuming the following holds: US life expectancy at birth for both genders falls below 75 years before 2040. Is it then the case that a global thermonuclear war will take place by 2070?"}

The industry in question must be one of the following: healthcare, automotive, finance, entertainment, or energy. Disruption is considered significant if it leads to a change in at least 20%% of the market share within the industry or a comparable metric of impact, such as a 20%% increase in efficiency or productivity. The resolution will rely on reports and analyses from the specified industry sources published by December 31, 2030. In the absence of clear industry consensus, a panel of experts from the affected industry may be consulted to determine the resolution.\n\n->\n\nreasoning: "to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030" is too fuzzy. question.body: Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

In particular:\n   - In case of events that happen at a fixed time (e.g. "Will France win the FIFA World Cup in 2026"), it should *never* be *before* the date when the event is scheduled to happen.
